job_title: Chief Executive Officer (CEO) in Cosham, England
cons: Working on more employee benefit schemes currently

review_title: Minimum wage for a stressful job - backwards ways of working. Great training opportunities though.
pros: Some good colleagues, lots of training and development opportunities.
cons:
Very backwards ways of working. 
A lot of misogyny and gender stereotypes, modern ways of working and thinking are not accepted. 
Pay is awful, minimum wage for a stressful and extremely busy job with high demand.
Senior management are very patronising, and treat the lower paid staff as exactly that, the bottom of the company lower paid staff. 
Took Covid to happen for the company to bring themselves ever so slightly more into the 21st century, no room for modern change.

job_title: Health and Safety Training Administrator in Cosham, England
pros: A place that look after their employees, a place that if you wish to develop and look for a long term career, will absolutely support you in this. As someone who has been here for a few months now, I am still so pleased to be here.
cons: This is a fast paced environment, and is it does get busy. Before starting and during the interview process, I feel I was made fully aware of this. So it was not a a shock.

pros: Supportive Management, friendly team, good salary, great work/life balance, great training
cons: Not gone paperless yet, wireless IT equipment would be good.

review_title: An amazing company to work for!
job_title: Health & Safety Trainer/Consultant in Cosham, England
pros: Incredibly professional and friendly place of work, who strive in getting the best out of its employees and pushing them further in their development.
cons: If they are any, I am not aware of them.

job_title: Conference Center Assistant in Portsmouth, Isle of Wight, South East England, England
pros: I just love it. The people, the core values, work-life balance, the energy...I honestly think I am very lucky for getting the opportunity to work for such an amazing company and with so many amazing people.
cons: Nothing that I can think of.

review_title: Progressive organisation that is investing for the future
job_title: Corporate Trainer in Portsmouth, Isle of Wight, South East England, England
pros: Living their own values by developing staff. Positive outlook for the future with investments being made
cons: Expected to deliver good customer service
